metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14386 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.9-rc4. Memory corruption can be exploited to gain root privileges from unprivileged processes. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity. Or Cohen discovered that the AF_PACKET implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1095-azure - 4.15.0-1095.105~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires CAP_NET_RAW cascardo> Added break as investigated by Solar Designer. sbeattie> older backports without 8e8e2951e309 will need second lore.kernel.org variant

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1095.105~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-signed package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1095.105~14.04.1').
